meanings.sent1: The edacious lion devoured its prey in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She had an edacious hunger after playing sports all day.
meanings.sent3: The edacious toddler finished his meal before anyone else.
meanings.sent4: Her edacious thirst for knowledge led her to read every book in the library.
meanings.sent5: The edacious monster in the story ate everything in its path.

meanings.sent1: The edacious squirrel raided the bird feeder for nuts.
meanings.sent2: He was known in the office for being edacious during lunchtime.
meanings.sent3: The edacious raccoon snuck into the trash can for a midnight snack.
meanings.sent4: Her edacious appetite for sweets always left her wanting more.
meanings.sent5: The edacious bear in the forest left a trail of empty berry bushes.

meanings.sent1: The edacious businessman always wanted more money.
meanings.sent2: She had an edacious desire for power and control.
meanings.sent3: The edacious child wanted all the toys in the store.
meanings.sent4: His edacious ambition drove him to succeed against all odds.
meanings.sent5: The edacious dragon hoarded gold in its lair.
